alert.note: Alert for Central Tularosa Basin; Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet; West Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 3:57PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Otero County through 430 PM MDT... At 357 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles south of Three Rivers to near Tularosa to 4 miles northeast of Holloman Air Force Base. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Tularosa, Alamogordo, Bent, Burro Flats, High Rolls, La Luz, Mountain Park, Holloman Air Force Base and Karr Canyon. This includes Highway 54 in New Mexico between mile markers 70 and 92. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Tularosa Basin; Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet; West Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet
